result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee Anthony Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 10-16-15. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lee Anthony Benson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lee Anthony Benson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Lee Anthony Benson in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  
Defendant ordered to serve 10 days in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence with credit of 0 days time served.  
Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 10-16-2015.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Lee Anthony Benson not in court, in custody, not produced.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MAYFAIR MALL.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Lee Anthony Benson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Lee Anthony Benson in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
